item.title: In a major update, Proton adds privacy-safe document collaboration to Drive, its freemium E2EE cloud storage service
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Collaborative document features are being made available inside Proton Drive, further extending the company's trademark pitch of robust security.

item.title: Telegram lets creators share paid content to channels
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Telegram launched a digital currency called Stars for in-app use last month. Now, the company is expanding its use cases to paid content. The chat app is also allowing channels to covert the stars they have to Toncoin — the cryptocurrency Telegram uses over The Open Network (TON) blockchain. Alternatively, they can use them to […]

item.title: Altrove uses AI models and lab automation to create new materials
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
For the past couple of years, innovation has been accelerating in new materials development. And a new French startup called Altrove plans to play a role in this innovation cycle. The deep tech startup has already raised €3.7 million (around $4 million at current exchange rates). If you’re interesting in new materials development, you may […]

item.title: Indian social network Koo is shutting down as buyout talks collapse
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
The Indian social media platform Koo, which positioned itself as a competitor to Elon Musk’s X, is ceasing operations after its last-resort acquisition talks with Dailyhunt collapsed. Despite securing over $60 million in funding from prominent investors including Tiger Global and Accel, Koo faced significant challenges in expanding its user base and generating revenue over […]

item.title: Europe is still serious about ESG, and Apiday is helping companies comply
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
Apiday leverages AI to save time for its customers. But like legacy consultants, it also offers human expertise.

item.title: Google’s environmental report pointedly avoids AI’s actual energy cost
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Google totally dodges the question of how much energy is AI is using — perhaps because the answer is "way more than we'd care to say."

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: SpaceX wants to launch up to 120 times a year from Florida — and competitors aren’t happy about it
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
SpaceX’s ambitious plans to launch its Starship mega-rocket up to 44 times per year from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center are causing a stir among some of its competitors. Late last month, Blue Origin and United Launch Alliance submitted comments calling on regulators to ensure minimal disruptions to other launch providers in the area, with Blue […]

item.title: Newsletter writer covering Evolve Bank’s data breach says the bank sent him a cease and desist letter
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo, Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
The situation around a data breach that’s affected an ever-growing number of fintech companies has gotten even weirder. Evolve Bank & Trust announced last week that it was hacked and confirmed the stolen data has been posted to the dark web. Now Evolve has sent a cease and desist letter to the writer of a […]

item.title: Twitter/X alternative Mastodon appeals to journalists with new ‘byline’ feature
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
The new bylines go beyond the typical @username references that often accompany link posts from news publications and those pointing to other written content, like a WordPress blog or Substack

item.title: X weighs adding a downvote button to replies — but it doesn’t want to emulate Reddit
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
code references found in the X iOS app indicate that the company could be considering adding downvotes for replies only to improve how they're ranked.

item.title: Yieldstreet says some of its customers were affected by the Evolve Bank data breach
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Evolve, a popular financial institution for fintech startups, announced that a cyberattack affected “the data and personal information of some Evolve retail bank customers and financial technology partners’ customers.”

item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech! This week, we’re looking at the Evolve Bank hack, three notable acquisitions, Plaid’s enterprise customer growth and more. item.title: What You Need to Raise a Series A Today at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
Raising a Series A round in today’s competitive market can be a daunting task. item.title: Snapchat’s latest features help users personalize their accounts
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Snapchat is introducing new ways for users to personalize their accounts, the company announced on Tuesday. The updates, which are mostly available for Snapchat+ subscribers, allow users to do things like design a personalized house on Snap Map, share super quick Snaps and edit their Bitmoji, among other things. At a time when social media […]

item.title: Meta plans to bring generative AI to metaverse games
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Meta plans to bring more generative AI tech into games, specifically VR, AR and mixed reality games, as the company looks to reinvigorate its flagging metaverse strategy. According to a job listing, Meta is seeking to research and prototype “new consumer experiences” with new types of gameplay driven by generative AI, like games that “change […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: A beginner’s guide to the fediverse
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
“Fediverse” is one of those terms that gets thrown around a lot, but what does it actually mean? The word comes from “federation” and “universe” being smooshed together, and it refers to a group of social networks — a federation, if you will — that can communicate with each other. This approach is pretty appealing when […]

item.title: News outlets are accusing Perplexity of plagiarism and unethical web scraping
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
In the age of generative AI, when chatbots can provide detailed answers to questions based on content pulled from the internet, the line between fair use and plagiarism, and between routine web scraping and unethical summarization, is a thin one.  Perplexity AI is a startup that combines a search engine with a large language model […]

item.title: Figma disables its AI design feature that appeared to be ripping off Apple’s Weather app
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
The Make Design feature is available within Figma's software and will generate UI (user interface) layouts and components from text prompts.

item.title: Computing and shielding startups join forces to put AI-capable chips in space
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Sophisticated spacecraft often run on shockingly outdated computing systems: consider that the Perseverance rover runs on a PowerPC 750, the processor famous for running on iMacs in the late 1990s.  San Francisco-based Aethero is aiming to bring more powerful computing systems to orbit, and their first payload launches this month on SpaceX’s Transporter-11 rideshare mission. […]

item.title: Sensorita uses digital twins to help waste management companies streamline construction waste
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
The amount of waste produced by the construction industry adds up to more than a third of the overall waste produced each year in the European Union. And it’s no better in the U.S. Stateside, the construction industry produces more than double the waste that households do each year. Sensorita wants to help the construction […]
